div.p: Definitely, I’d say I had a bad experience with drugs, I got onto some pretty hard drugs at quite a young age which definitely had an impact
on my school life although you know I didn’t take drugs in school it was obviously the people you can get to know outside of school
just from going out, just from leaving your door no-one really knows; I got involved with the wrong crowd, started using cocaine and
things just sort of spiralled out of control from there really I think and while I was at school especially in my second from last year,
Year 10, when you’re getting ready to sit your GCSEs and things it really impacted and actually in my last year at school when I went to sit some of them
it got to the point where I couldn’t go into an exam because my mind was just not there, not in it, I think there’s a time in everyone’s life
when they don’t feel like they can achieve anything but especially in mine I think because of the drug taking, because I got kicked out
of college all those things combined together I just thought "I haven’t got a hope in hell"; I remember sitting sometimes and thinking
"God, what are you going to do with your life? You’ve just totally messed everything up" but I think just being headstrong and being clear
in your head that "no, this isn’t me, I can do more I’m going to go and do more", seeking help from the right places, having a good support network
around you and then sitting down and deciding what you’re going to do with your life and actually actioning it and going out and doing it
and going through the right procedures, going through training, going through everything you need to do to get there and it’s not
a waste of time because you’re learning more as you’re doing it so even if you don’t end up doing what you wanted to do originally I think
it’s always going to come in handy, it’s always going to be useful.
